Description: Shoulder sherd with part of double arched handle of East Greek grey ware pottery closed vessel, a krater or hydria; exterior: worn dark grey slip on handles; incised pattern at bottom where handles join, most probably part of calyx of a palmette; plastic decoration (now missing) between handles.
Curator's comments: The sherd is strikingly similar to British Museum 1888,0601.647.c and d. In the same style is the handle fragment of a jug or hydria found on Samos (Walter-Karydi, ‘Samos - VI/1 Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts v. Chr.’, (Deutsches Archäologisches Institut), Bonn (1973), pl. 60, no. 497) with relief volute palmette. Missing plastic decoration may have resembled the palmette bud on British Museum sherd 1888,0601.647.d, though the details of this fragment show it to be from a different vase. 1888,0601.647.c has similar treatment of the inner surface and may well be from the same pot..
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.086)
